titles.title: Permitting the use of the rotunda of the Capitol for a ceremony to award a Congressional Gold Medal to Dr. Dorothy Height.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.
Mr. Mica moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 357.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 2/25/2004--Passed Senate without amendment. Authorizes the use of the Capitol rotunda on March 24, 2004, for a ceremony to award a Congressional Gold Medal to Dr. Dorothy Height.
